intro: Croton megalocalyx, commonly known as the giant croton, is a striking tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by bright orange or red seed pods. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
